criteria.name: Process & Product Justification
criteria.desc: Clarity on chosen process/product, uses, current & projected demand; rationale for process selection and comparison to alternatives.

levels.3: Explains state-of-the-art process and product clearly; justifies product with uses and credible US/global demand; compares main process to alternatives with reasons for selection.
levels.2: Provides most elements (uses and some demand) and a basic comparison, but rationale or data depth is limited or partially cited.
levels.1: Missing demand or uses; little to no comparison/justification; vague or unsupported claims.

criteria.name: Base PFD & Unit Operations
criteria.desc: Process Flow Diagram of the original process; key unit operations and any reactions described.

levels.3: Contains a complete, readable PFD for the base process; identifies 3–5 major unit ops (excl. pumps/compressors) and any reactions; descriptions are accurate.
levels.2: PFD present but missing some streams/units or brief/incomplete descriptions.
levels.1: No PFD or an unusable/incorrect diagram; unit operations not identified or misrepresented.

criteria.name: Thermodynamic Model & Simulation Plan
criteria.desc: Statement of Aspen Plus use; thermodynamic model choice and justification with data/model comparison.

levels.3: States Aspen Plus will be used; selects an appropriate thermo model and justifies it with graphs comparing experimental data to chosen and alternate models.
levels.2: States Aspen Plus and model; partial or light justification (limited comparison or missing plots).
levels.1: No clear plan for Aspen; model not justified or missing.

criteria.name: Economic Viability (Max Profit) & Data Sources
criteria.desc: Calculation of maximum possible profit using current bulk chemical costs; references provided.

levels.3: Performs a defensible max-profit estimate using current bulk prices; shows key assumptions, references cost sources, and indicates viability.
levels.2: Provides a profit estimate but with unclear assumptions, older prices, or weak sourcing.
levels.1: No estimate or non-reproducible numbers; lacks current costs and references.

criteria.name: Improvements, Appendices & Professionalism
criteria.desc: Proposed improvements; appendices (economic calcs/kinetics if applicable, Gantt chart); formatting, grammar, aesthetics, and overall clarity.

levels.3: Proposes specific, technically motivated improvements; includes relevant appendices (calcs/kinetics if applicable) and a Gantt chart with responsibilities; writing is polished, formatted per spec, and professional.
levels.2: Improvements mentioned but high-level; appendices or Gantt are partial; minor issues in formatting/grammar.
levels.1: Vague or missing improvements; key appendices absent; poor formatting/grammar hinders readability.
